head.supplied: S. Yarra, 14/9/94. ¶ ¶ Please, dear Dr Bride, convey to the trustees of the public Libr. & Museums my best thanks for the kindness of allowing me to obtain some surplus-woods. ¶ I shall require only...

div.p: No. 94-1369, unit 181, VPRS 805, inward and outward correspondence — subject, VA 913 Public Library of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Please, dear Dr Bride, convey to the trustees of the public Libr. & Museums my best thanks for the kindness of allowing me to obtain some surplus-woods.
See M to T. Bride, 7 September 1894 (in this edition as 94-09-07a). I shall require only small pieces. I thank you also for the kind interest evinced by you in this subject. Mr Newbery was good enough to send Mr Wetherall out to my Office, which accelerates and facilitates the whole arrangement, as I told Mr W exactly what is required, and as my Woodworker, Mr Traeger, will call on Mr Wetherell personally.
